ref: 222 attā f. ʻ mother, mother's sister, elder sister ʼ lex., atti(kā) -- , anti(kā) -- f. ʻ elder sister ʼ lex. 2. *addā -- . [← Drav. Tam. attai ʻ aunt, mother -- in -- law ʼ T. Burrow BSOAS xii 366. Cf. *atta -- 2]
Pk. attā -- f. ʻ mother, father's elder sister, husband's mother ʼ, an interchange of meaning due to
Or. atā, ātā ʻ term of address to mother and elder sister ʼ, ātā ʻ father's sister ʼ;
Or. atā, ātā ʻ term of address to mother and elder sister ʼ, ātā ʻ father's sister ʼ;
Or. atā, ātā ʻ term of address to mother and elder sister ʼ, ātā ʻ father's sister ʼ;
M. āt, ātas, ātū, āte, ātes f. ʻ father's sister ʼ.
